description: dark image in dark brown; street scene with white horse at center harnessed to wagon; shadowy figure at left lifting object over his head to a figure in another wagon behind horse
inscription:
Signature and Inscription

on back, in pencil: [4504], [8100123] and [95.29.2]
provenance: [Childs Gallery, Boston, until 1996; sold in April for PROO, to Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (1996-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: LLC, in the print: [E. C / (illegible)]; LRC, in pencil: [-Edgar Chahine-]
text: In the faint light of early morning, workers collect garbage to haul away. Edgar Chahine’s murky image presents these laborers as they may have been perceived by much of the general public, faceless and barely seen.
title: Trash Collectors
